intro: Eugenia alcinae, commonly known as the Alcina's eugenia, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pink flowers and elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within dense forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Eugenia alcinae is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
